1.verse: Greetings to a House Group - Paul, a prisoner of Messiah Yeshua, and Timothy our brother, to Philemon our beloved and fellow worker.

2.verse: To Apphia our sister, to Archippus our fellow soldier, and to the community that meets in your house:

3.verse: Grace to you and shalom from God our Father and the Lord Messiah Yeshua!

4.verse: Thanks for Love and Comfort - I thank my God always when mentioning you in my prayers,

5.verse: hearing of your love and the trust you have toward the Lord Yeshua and all the kedoshim.

6.verse: May the fellowship of your faith become effective, with the recognition of all the good that is ours in Messiah.

7.verse: For I’ve received much joy and comfort in your love, brother, because the hearts of the kedoshim have been refreshed through you.

8.verse: Request for Philemon’s Runaway - Therefore, though I have plenty of boldness in Messiah to order you to do what’s right,

9.verse: yet for love’s sake I appeal to you instead. I, Paul, am an old man and now also a prisoner belonging to Messiah Yeshua.

10.verse: I beg you for my child Onesimus—for whom I became a spiritual father while in chains.

11.verse: He once was useless to you, but now is useful both to you and me.

12.verse: I sent him back to you—he is my very heart.

13.verse: I really wanted to keep him with me, so that on your behalf he might serve me while I am in chains for the Good News.

14.verse: But I didn’t want to do anything without your consent, so that your goodness wouldn’t be by force but by free will.

15.verse: For perhaps he was separated from you for a while in order that you might have him back forever,

16.verse: no longer as a slave but more than a slave—as a beloved brother, especially to me but even more so to you, both in the flesh and in the Lord.

17.verse: So if you consider me a partner, welcome him as you would welcome me.

18.verse: But if he has done you any wrong or owes you anything, charge that to my account.

19.verse: I, Paul, am writing this with my own hand: I will repay. (Not to mention that you owe me your very self.)

20.verse: Yes, brother, let me have some benefit from you in the Lord. Refresh my heart in Messiah.

21.verse: Added Request and Farewell - Having confidence in your obedience, I write to you, knowing that you will do even more than what I say.

22.verse: At the same time also, prepare a guest room for me—for I hope that through your prayers I will be given back to you.

23.verse: Epaphras, my fellow prisoner in Messiah Yeshua, greets you.

24.verse: So do Mark, Aristarchus, Demas, and Luke, my fellow workers.

25.verse: May the grace of our Lord Messiah Yeshua be with your spirit. Amen.
